intro: Neo-uvaria sparsistellata, commonly known as the sparse-starred uvaria, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native forest ecosystems.
